name: 'Constituency Of One' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: To whom did Amy compare the newspaper's reference to Josh as 'the 101st Senator'?
questions.explanation:
The fifth Beatle.

	Calling Josh 'the 101st Senator' was among many references that were made to Josh in an article written about him in the "Washington Post". Josh wanted all the copies gathered up and Donna suggested burning them on the south lawn.

questions.text: What did Will tell Toby he was going to start carrying a picture of in his wallet?
options: What he looked like before he worked at the White House
questions.explanation:
Bed.

	Toby and Will had been working on the schedule for days and Will was tired so he told Toby he was going to start carrying a picture of his bed in his wallet so he could remember what it looked like.

questions.text: About what embassy party did Ryan tell CJ?
questions.explanation:
Australian & Australia.

	Ryan told CJ there was a party at the Australian embassy and CJ told him. When CJ suggested that Ryan meant they attend together she said, 'there aren't enough phone books in the District of Columbia for you to stand on'.

questions.text: Who gave "The Washington Post" the information for the article on Josh?
questions.explanation:
Amy.

	Amy gave "The Washington Post" the information for the article since it was Josh's birthday. Josh didn't like the fact that he was getting better press than President Bartlet.

questions.text: Which senior staff member referred back to the magazine article about Josh by calling him "the Jewish-Connecticut Corleone"?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	Everyone had gathered for the morning meeting and CJ repeated a comment that the newspaper article had about Josh. Toby mentioned that he couldn't even get on the cover of "Jane's Defense Weekly".

questions.text: Which veteran actor played Democratic Senator Chris Carrick?
questions.explanation:
Tom Skerritt.

	Tom Skerritt played Idaho Democratic Senator Chris Carrick. At the end of the episode, Senator Carrick resigned from the Democratic party due to no one giving him what he wanted.

questions.text: What did Josh find on his desk that made his whole office stink?
options: Fetal pig wrapped in plastic wrap
questions.explanation:
Fish wrapped in newspaper.

	Josh found the item laying on his desk when he went into his office. Toby thought his office smelled like a fish cannery. Donna told Josh the fish had been in his office since the night before when Amy put it there.

questions.text: Will left the White House to work in Vice President Russell's office.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Toby didn't want Will to work for Russell because he was grooming Will to take over as Head of Communications, however, President Bartlet told Will he could work for Russell and Leo told Toby the decision had already been made.

questions.text: When Amy referred to the constituency of one, about whom was she talking?
options: That guy in the mail room that knows all the gossip
questions.explanation:
Herself.

	Amy had just been fired by POTUS for getting funding for domestic violence by using Mrs. Bartlet's name. After firing Amy, President Bartlet hired her back, but Amy had already decided that she needed to leave.

questions.text: Did Josh get the birthday party that he specifically asked not to have?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	After receiving Carrick's resignation, Josh went into the Mural room where he thought Leo was waiting to see him. When he opened the door, he found a birthday party waiting for him with a cake shaped as a fish.
